result.execSummary:
The defendant Jackie Soto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment plan of $25.00/month commencing 1st day of the month on the second month after Deft's release

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jackie Soto

defendant.name: Soto, Jackie
defendant.address: 888 E Shady Lane Apt 303, Neenah, WI 54956

records.addlTxt: Payment plan of $25.00/month commencing 1st day of the month on the second month after Deft's release

9:37 AM Defendant Jackie Soto appeared by phone, in custody at Calumet County Jail.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III appeared by phone for Jackie Soto.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights on file.
Defendant waives right to an in-person hearing today. Court finds valid waiver.
State's recommendation - Count 1 - $100.00 +costs and Defense free to argue, Count 2 to be Dismissed and Read in.
Deft pleads No Contest to Count 1 - Court finds Deft Guilty of Count 1 and Count 2 is Dismissed and Read in.
State makes sentencing argument.
Atty Forella makes sentencing argument - requests lower fine and payment plan commencing 30-60 days after release from custody.
Court orders $100.00 fine +costs with payment plan of $25.00/month commencing 1st day of the month on the second month after Deft's release.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

*NOT ON RECORD*Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael A. Forella III appeared by phone for Jackie Soto. 
Discovery received. Offer received. Case can be set for plea/sentencing. Attorney Forelle advises that DE is in Calumet County Jail
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
